tool_description: Children's Book Library - Thousands of picture books for kids
name: MagicBlox
title: MagicBlox

api_list.name: book
api_list.description:
## Two ways to use this endpoint:
1. Search by category, language, reading level, section, title, author, or any combination of these filters. This will give you a list of books to discover, along with metadata, a cover image for each book, and the book's NID number.

2. Use the NID of a book (with no other parameters) to get the content pages of the book, along with its metadata and cover image. This will only work for a single NID at a time. This is counted as a "read" and counts toward your quota. **Important: You must send us your watermark in order to access this content. More information below.**

## Required: Your watermark
Before you can see the contents of our books, you must send us an image we can use to watermark each page (usually your company's logo). We do this to protect our content creators. Please send your watermark in .png format to apisupport@magicblox.com. Images should be no more than 100 pixels high and no more than 200 pixels wide and should have a transparent background.

optional_parameters.name: seed
optional_parameters.description: Specify a seed (between 1 and1000000) to randomize your results. Results randomized in this way will always return in the same order, so you can paginate (see limit and offset) a randomly ordered set of results without seeing the same book twice or missing a book.

optional_parameters.name: reading_level
optional_parameters.description:
Returns a specified books section.

**Possible values:**
- 'Beginner (1 to 6)'
- 'Intermediate (6 to 9)'
- 'Advanced (9 to 13)'

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description:
Sets to offset of the books returned. Use this in collaboration with the 'limit' parameter to implement pagination.

For example, if your search results in 100 books, you could retrieve all of them by specifying a limit of 20 and making five queries with offsets 0, 20, 40, 60, and 80.

optional_parameters.name: nid
optional_parameters.description:
Use the NID of a book (with no other parameters) to get the content pages of the book, along with its metadata and cover image. This will only work for a single NID at a time. This is counted as a \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"read\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" and counts toward your quota. **Important: You must send us your watermark in order to access this content. More information below.**

### Required: Your watermark
But before you can see the contents of our books, you must send us an image we can use to watermark each page (usually your company's logo). We do this to protect our content creators. Please send your watermark in .png format to apisupport@magicblox.com. Images should be no more than 100 pixels high and no more than 200 pixels wide and should have a transparent background.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description:
Limits the number of books returned by the query. Use this in collaboration with the 'offset' parameter to implement pagination.

For example, if your search results in 100 books, you could retrieve all of them by specifying a limit of 20 and making five queries with offsets 0, 20, 40, 60, and 80.

optional_parameters.name: author
optional_parameters.description: Returns books with authors similar to author param.

optional_parameters.name: section
optional_parameters.description:
Returns a specified books section.

**Possible values:**
- 'all'
- 'award-winning'
- 'featured'
- 'most-read'
- 'recently-added'

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
Restricts results to the specified language.

**Possible values:**
- 'English'
- 'Spanish'
- 'Italian'
- 'French'
- 'German'
- 'Mongolian'
- 'Portuguese'
- 'Hebrew'

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: Returns books with titles similar to the title param.

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: Specify a category by tid obtained from the /categories endpoint.

api_list.name: sandbox
api_list.description:
An endpoint intended for testing the API. This works exactly like the /book endpoint but without the quota limitations.

## Two ways to use this endpoint:
1. Search by category, language, reading level, section, title, author, or any combination of these filters. This will give you a list of books to discover, along with metadata, a cover image for each book, and the book's NID number.

2. Use the NID of a book (with no other parameters) to get the content pages of the book, along with its metadata and cover image. This will only work for a single NID at a time.

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: Returns books with titles similar to the title param.

optional_parameters.name: author
optional_parameters.description: Returns books with authors similar to author param.

optional_parameters.name: nid
optional_parameters.description: Use the NID of a book (with no other parameters) to get the content pages of the book, along with its metadata and cover image. This will only work for a single NID at a time.

optional_parameters.name: reading_level
optional_parameters.description:
Returns a specified books section.

**Possible values:**
- 'Beginner (1 to 6)'
- 'Intermediate (6 to 9)'
- 'Advanced (9 to 13)'

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: Specify a category by tid obtained from the /categories endpoint.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
Restricts results to the specified language.

**Possible values:**
- 'English'
- 'Spanish'
- 'Italian'
- 'French'
- 'German'
- 'Mongolian'
- 'Portuguese'

optional_parameters.name: section
optional_parameters.description:
Returns a specified books section.

**Possible values:**
- 'all'
- 'award-winning'
- 'featured'
- 'most-read'
- 'recently-added'

api_list.name: categories
api_list.description: Returns an array of possible categories to be used in the book and sandbox endpoints
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://magicblox.p.rapidapi.com/v1/categories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "magicblox.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://magicblox.p.rapidapi.com/v1/categories"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "magicblox.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
